result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaylen M. Bounds

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jaylen M. Bounds in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Jaylen M. Bounds.  Attorney Samuel Tabin in court for State of Wisconsin. The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Stark, Branch 17 for a review hearing.
Review hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jaylen M. Bounds in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Jaylen M. Bounds.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.
For reasons set forth in the record, State has not completed DPA and requests additional time.
Case is adjourned for Deferred Prosecution Agreement in Branch 13.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jaylen M. Bounds in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jaylen M. Bounds appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case remains in DPA posture. Defendant to schedule TAD evaluation. Defense counsel informed the Court that discovery has not been received.   DPA Hearing adjourned to Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jaylen M. Bounds in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jaylen M. Bounds appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defense counsel has not received discovery or offer and requests additional time to receive. Defendant to schedule TAD evaluation.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f. Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
of Representation by Attorney Corey Flynn
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jaylen M. Bounds in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/18/2022#1:30pm
